comments:
Using the latest plugins from HEAD I ended up with an infinitely refreshing 
variables view. In the progress view I saw the job "Restore Viewer State" 
running over and over.

I cannot make it happen on demand, but it happens periodically. Selecting 
another stack fame made the problem stop.

I have a reproducible testcase which shows this problem and a couple of others.
 Luckily the same steps will show both (as far as I have seen).

In my case I was debugging JavaCompletionProposal, so I placed a breakpoint
within its constructor (line 112).
I launched an Eclipse Application and created a new Java Project with a single
class called Test.  I added a single instance variable of type Vector and hit
Ctrl-Space (Content Assist).  This should cause the breakpoint to be triggered.

Now this is where it may take a few tries but repeated attempts seem to cause
the problem.

Expand an item in the variables pane.
Select another stack frame, I usually go for SearchableEnvironment.  Expand a
variable there. Now hit F6.
If it doesn't happen, hit F6 a few times and repeat the process of expand a
variable and selecting another frame and expanding followed by F6.  Eventually
it will loop.

Some of the other problems I have seen are missing variables like this or a
variable with no value just see ... or I get a debug error.
I have also seen bogus stack frames.

My .log shows multiple exceptions:

A bit of an update.

The timeout exception below was my bad.  Debugging causes this.  What is
interesting is that the response is in the linked list, but since the timeout is
determined first, the reply isn't picked up.

The IllegalArgumentException is a bug in the code since it sends a null message
which is disallowed (not in the javadoc though).

And finally, the loop.  I don't know what causes it but I do know the sequence
now.  It happens on both Java 5 and J9.

-> = invokes    ... = job execution

RemoteTreeContentManager.replaceChildren() -> WorkbenchJob.schedule() ...
VariableViewer.runDeferredUpdates() -> fStateRestorationJob.schedule() ...
StateRestorationJob.runInUIThread() ->
RemoteVariableContentManager.startFetchingDeferedChildren() ... 
DeferredStackFrame.startFetchingDeferedChildren ->
RemoteTreeContentManager.replaceChildren()
*** Bug 83635 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

caused by attempts to restore the variables view to a previous state that was 
invalid. The ViewerState would attempt to decode a path that didn't exist in 
the variables view tree, this would cause the content provider to 
asynchronously getChildren(), the tree would get updated and the we'd attempt 
to restore the state again.
When restoring the state of a remote tree viewer we should only be interested 
in it's current state, the viewer is responsible for maintaining that state. 
Changed AbstractViewerState to getCurrentChildren() instead of getChildren() 
when the view is a remote tree viewer.
*** Bug 83507 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I don't think this is fixed. Even with the latest code from HEAD, expanding the
variables view has been repeatedly making the UI go unresponsive for a minute or
so at a time.

The variables view in my target becomes completely unusable very often. I
haven't pinned down an exact test case for the problem I'm seeing, but I'd say
about 1/5 of the time I launch, expand the tree, and try to right click I
discover that my UI (my entire desktop) has stopped responding. It takes my
machine a few minutes to clear up. With the contents of the view occasionally
coming and going... it's really bad.

This happens for me too. And sometimes I expand a variable in the Variables View
and then after a bit of flashing the tree collapses.

(although it doesn't happen as often as in the first integration build)
*** Bug 83816 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

So far I haven't been able to reproduce the described behavior on I20050126-0800. This may be 
related to bug #83783. There is a patch attached to that bug report, but it's untested because I haven't 
been able to reproduce that one yet either.

I can reproduce flashing in the variables view on GTK. I haven't yet seen the variables view become 
unusable. It has always settled down quickly.
Does not seem to be the restore state job that is causing the problem. I've commented that code out 
completely and it has not changed anything wrt to flashing at least.
